intro: Vernonia moquinioides, commonly known as the golden ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in late summer and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
